ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I was very disappointed in the course. I learned very little from the material and was not challenged. The syllabus did not accurately represent what was covered in the course. The material was very watered down and elementary. We did not have assignments or readings that helped us to engage with and learn the material.
Professor Khalil really cares about student learning. He was always willing to meet with students at any time to discuss their term papers, and he offered helpful advice for how to continue.
Professor Khalil's lectures were very interesting. More course readings would have been welcome.

Professor Khalil struggled in teaching us how to conduct risk assessments. He was vague and never used case studies to illustrate how to apply the methodologies. This was very sad because he such a sweet man and seemed to enjoy teaching, he just couldn't do it well. The guest lecture we had and all the lectures on renewable energies were irrelevant and had nothing to with risk assessments whatsoever but with his green energy class he teaches online in the summer. He kept trying to sell himself to us but should've done it In a more educational way.

Although the professor is very opened to help and orient students throughout the course, I think that the course wasnt well structured. The readings and assignments were not alligned with the theory revised in class. Environmental Risk Assessment is best learned through applied work, implementing risk assessment models to real world cases. We did not apply the models until the final term project, which I thought it was a weakness. The course is also mostly appropriate for students interested in industrial operation or public health. In my case as a land manager, I see less opportunities for applying these type of tools on my field.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Risk assessment can be applied to many different aspects of the environment, so this class had something for everyone.

The ability to work on an in-depth research project (term paper) that allowed each of us to dive deeply into subjects that interest us, and gain experience applying the risk analysis methods we learned in the course.
Professor is very enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the topics covered.
The instructor provided valuable case studies related to what was being discussed in class. The homework assignments were also helpful in terms of providing real world information
He's very sweet and the workload was very little. Additionally only having class for two hours a week was great.
The professor cared deeply about his students success
The professor is very caring about his students.
Wide variety of risk tools covered. Final project was a crucial application for this.
Using risk mgt models and tools

In my view, the final term project was the most significant contribution to my learning experience. It was the only assignment were I saw an increase in my knowledge and where I realized the potentials and limitations of a specific risk assessment method.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: There need to be readings and assignments that help to drive the material home and provide learning tools. Case examples and readings or problem sets would be a good/necessary addition.
Sometimes I was confused about dates and when things were due; dates on the syllabus differed from what the professor shared in class.

I would have liked to do more technical, hands-on work with the risk analysis tools and methods we were presented. For instance, working directly with some of the statistical tools would have been helpful.
It would have been great to dig deeper into the use of risk assessment software and use it for assignments.
A little more focus on environmental issues outside the industrial field
The material was horrendous and Ill-taught and Ill-chosen

I feel that because we weren't in the engineering school that the professor was afraid to dive too deeply into the risk assessment methodologies. I wish we could have had more assignments focusing on the methodologies we learned in class
Sometimes the lectures were a bit unclear.
Contents don't fit MEM profile. Teacher doesn't have empathy purr communication skills. Too much nuclear.

Could have had more readings on the pros and cons of different risk tools (if there are such things) or more specific discussion of the benefits of using one over the other in different contexts. Also more updated material - risk is a hot topic in sustainability consulting right now - how is this being applied for business leaders and governments currently? Has the field changed?
None
I would strengthen the application of the different models to real life situations. Learning by doing is key in this field.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: There was no discussion/lab section
N/A

There was little relationship between the readings and the different risk assessment models. Although I see a value in having readings that motivate students for innovating and starting new entrepreneurships in the environmental field, I think the focus of the course was sometimes lost and most of the assignments should have focused on the applications of the ERA tools and methods.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Risk analysis, or at least the language of risk analysis, is very important to the research I aim to do at FES.
I was hoping this class would add a skill set to my collection so I could be better prepared to make decisions involving trade offs.
Risk assessment is a valuable skill for any student in an environmentally-related field.
Fits in with industrial ecology focus which looks at system design.
It does as Environmental risk is important aspect of adverse environmental challenges as a people, community or organization

The course doesnt really fit into my land management interest. It should be made clear that ERA is most appropriate for industrial processes and public health, but not so much for land managers (at least it is not the major application area).

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course to give myself a background on risk measurement for us in a research/consulting context.
Assessing the risks associated with any type of process or technology is important to understanding how humans or the environment may be harmed. I wanted to know about ways to identify this risk.
Learn quantitative methods of risk analysis and gain experience applying these methods to problems of interest.
As someone interested in environmental policy, being able to understand and measure risk is an important skill
Because I feel like risk assessment is a useful skill to have and is relevant to many fields and jobs.
Requirement for specialization in Business and the Environment
I thought it would be good to start building a secondary area of interest that goes beyond land management and could be applicable in agriculture or extractive industries.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: No, they did not. I have a cursory outline of what environmental risk assessment includes, but do not understand the tools in depth or have an idea of how it looks in practice.
Yes.
I feel that I learned a lot, but would have appreciated more technical practice with each of the risk analysis tools.
Yes, the course discussed ways of assessing various risks. However, a little more linkage to environmental issues such as waste issues would be better.
I was very disappointed with this class
I would have liked to see more time spent on learning the different methods of measuring risk
Yes
No, I could have learned it faster and more in depth.
Yes!
Yes
Not entirely. I expected a stronger focus on the application of the ERA methods through practical exercises.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I did not participate in group work

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Professor Khalil is such a nice person, and I think you can learn a lot from him. I would definitely recommend taking the course.

Spend time going deep into your term paper research with Prof. Khalil early in the semester. He is incredibly knowledgable in the field and can help you build a very rich body of research. Output is directly proportional to input.
Don't take it unless the syllabus is revamped
Try to pace yourself when working on the final paper so that you don't have to rush to finish it at the end.
It's easy but hard to understand.

If you are interested in industrial processes or public health issues, this could be of your interest. Environmental Risk Assessment was not so much of my interest as a land management or biodiversity conservation oriented student. Yehia Khalil is very opened to help students through the final term project and is a dedicated instructor. The course does not focus on the practical application of ERA methods, but provides an overview of the different methods and models used in this field.
